item.title: Need some help with the 'Yell' command
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]That’s because the interfaces, ‘sendFrame126/sendQuest’ whatever the method may be, allows the use of colored text.

Though, the basic 317 client does not allow colored text in the chat box, unless you manipulate the client.

Go look for the guide.[/quote]

I quite understand why already but thank you anyways. I asked for what you think I should type in the search box. I don’t have a clue what I should put in. I’m searching colors in chat box. Would that work you think?

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help with the 'Yell' command

item.title: Need some help with the 'Yell' command
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

All right I’ve recently developed (other servers may have this, im not saying its original or anything like that) a new ::yell system. I saw something on a server’s client.java and I went to create one like it, just making the size of the method smaller.
What I would like done is to make it so that when a player of certain Rights yells, the color of the text and etc. is different.

Here’s the code I have:
Code:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0) {
String titles = “”;

            if ((donator == 1) && (playerRights <= 0)) {
	    titles = "[Premium Member] ";
	}
            if (playerRights == 1) {
                titles = "[Moderator] ";
            }
            if (playerRights == 2) {
                titles = "[Administrator] ";
            }

	if (playerRights == 0) {
                titles = "[Player] ";
            }

            if (playerRights == 3) {
                titles = "[Co-Owner] ";
            }
	
	
	if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("####")) {
                titles = "@red@[OWNER] ";
            }

           yell(titles + "" + playerName + ": "
                    + command.substring(5));
    }[/code]

Okay so the problem is, when I yell as the owner, in the chat box it actually says ‘@red@[Owner] :’ How do I make it change color

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help with the 'Yell' command
